name: Crash Dive
description: WWII tactical submarine combat! Take command of a U-boat prowling the Atlantic in search of enemy convoys to sink. Sneak past the escorts and torpedo the transports. Or surface and use your deck gun in a daring night attack.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP Processor: Intel Atom Memory: 1 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 220 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: 7 Processor: Core i5 Memory: 4 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 310 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Reminds me a bit of 'Silent Service 2' in that it's less of a sim and more arcadey in nature, has challenge missions, and features a campaign tasking you with patrolling the seas for prey. The water effects are my favorite part in all honesty, the rest is simply 'there'. If you're looking for an in-depth submarine simulator, this is not it. If you're just looking to spend a few minutes torpedoing ships out of the water, then give this a look. I'm giving it a positive recommend because it's very similar to 'SS2' and it's more convenient to play this than to bring my NES out of mothballs.          YouTubeâ„¢ Video:  DGA Plays: Crash Dive (Ep. 1 - Gameplay / Let's Play)

It is an arcadey submarine game with hints of simmulation...well, a sprinkling. In light of so many games that take themselves so seriously, this one is a good balance to me. I find it a lot like Pringles...you know it's not real chips but dang it they're enjoyable...just one more! For price vs quality its a good deal, I reccomend this as a fun time killer, you will try again to see how much you can do in the limited 'fuel tim' you have. And watch that periscope...it'll get you in trouble!
Worth a couple of quid. It doesn't have much replay value as it's very arcadey, but it's given me about 4 hours worth of play time so that's good enough for me :)
play this or do you know a better Sub game?
Lacks the gameplay depth and graphics of Silent Hunter 4 and 5. A bit too arcade-y for me.
